VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-01] Loans of tokens with >18 decimals can result in incorrect collateral calculation
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Loans of tokens with >18 decimals can result in incorrect collateral calculation, causing an underflow to the power of 10 which will cause the division to yield 0 and thus cause the Loan to calculate 0 as collateral required for the loan.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Applying the same paradigm as _toWad or requiring that the token have <= 18 decimals

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-02] Potential huge arbitrage opportunities / MPL price decrease
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: Potential huge arbitrage opportunities / MPL price decrease
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Hard to completely mitigate. Pool delegates should be especially careful when giving out high-value loans and demand high collateral lockup.

VulnerabilityDesc.Name: [M-03] Bypass or reduction on the lockup period of Pool FDTs.
VulnerabilityDesc.Type: Bypass or reduction of lockup period
VulnerabilityDesc.Description: The lockup restriction of withdrawal (Pool.sol#396) can be bypassed or reduced if new liquidity providers cooperate with existing ones.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Forcing users to wait for the lockup period when transferring FDT to others or let the depositDate variable record the timestamp of the last operation instead of a weighted timestamp.
